title: Events
intro: I like to speak, share my skills with an audience and coach young developers. Below is a list of events I took part in as a presenter, organiser or a coach. For my talks I prepare all the content myself and carefully select the exercises. Sometimes I also enjoy to take part in programming competitions.

records.title: Grunt
records.description:
A talk about Grunt task runner where I demonstrated what it is, what are the benefits of using a task runner, how to install and use Grunt and explained the meaning of every step in detail.
I wrote a post about this talk on my blog.

records.title: Behaviour Driven Development with Jasmine
records.description:
A Labcamp is an event starting with a presentation which is then followed by a friendly competition. During the presentation I made a very brief introduction to Test Driven Developement, compared to Behaviour Driven Developement and demonstrated the basics of Jasmine framework. For the competition I prepared a selection of katas and participants were invited to write quality tests for each of the exercise.
You can read more about this Labcamp on my blog.

records.title: Behaviour Driven Development with Jasmine
records.description: A workshop where I taught Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development. Participants went through a step-by-step exercise on building Javascript validation in BDD style using Jasmine framework.

records.title: HTML, CSS & JavaScript
records.description: Series of workshops where I coached beginner web developers with HTML, CSS and Javascript by working through the exercises with them. The exercises were prepared by OpenTechSchool.

records.title: HTML, CSS, JavaScript & Python
records.description: Series of workshops where I helped beginner web developers with HTMl, CSS, JavaScript and Python by working through the exercises with them. The exercises were prepared by Codebar founders.

records.title: Mind Sports Olympiad - Programming Competition
records.description: Programming is one of the competitions within a huge and exciting event - Mind Sports Olympiad. Participants were given 3 hours to solve 4 algorithmic tasks in a programming language of their preference. Please checkout this GitHub repository to find out more. After great 3 hours of programming I came 4th.

records.title: Open Team Programming Collegiate Cup
records.description: This a programming competition for the teams, where participants solve the puzzles remotely and submit their solutions through the system. Solution is evaluated not only by the fact whether it produces correct results, but also by its performance. All the tasks required to come up with complex algorithms.
